title: Online Science Education Design and Satisfaction Improvement Strategies for Adult Learners

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level specialized knowledge in the field and extensive practical experience
context.additional_context: A science education competency enhancement program for pre-/in-service secondary teachers, involving case-based projects to solve real classroom problems.

learning_goals: Applying Problem-Based Learning (PBL), learners can identify three or more science class issues in real educational settings and propose solutions.

Learners analyze three real-world problem cases in science education, design problem-specific solutions in five or fewer steps using LMS-based collaboration tools (Google Workspace, Padlet, etc.), and achieve an average score of 4 or higher on a 5-point peer evaluation rubric for team presentations.
Learners can establish and implement self-directed learning plans in online learning environments by applying learning-content interaction strategies.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
